title: Answering Exile: how Sudanese refugees deal with displacement
abstractText:
This project sets out to develop recent thinking on the socio-cultural construction of place in the context of debates about human displacement and emplacement. Its ethnographic focus is some of the multiply displaced Southern Sudanese groups currently resident in Uganda and in Sudan. 
The project investigates relationships between place and the social and ritual activity performed there, and raises questions about the construction of identity and of social value in this context. It considers both social memories of the past and imagined futures, the latter having particular relevance at a time when repatriation to the 'homeland' is under active consideration
